content:
Diagnosis:
Microcystic serous carcinoma of pancreatic tail, T2N1M0

Surgery:
Distal pancreatectomy and splenectomy performed 15 Jan 2024 by [redacted name]

Histology:
Microcystic serous carcinoma, 3.8cm, clear margins (R0)
Two positive peripancreatic lymph nodes from 14 sampled
VHL mutation detected

Treatment completed:
6 cycles adjuvant gemcitabine completed 20 April 2024

Current situation:
End of treatment assessment

I reviewed [redacted name] today following completion of adjuvant chemotherapy. She has tolerated the treatment well with only grade 1 fatigue and mild nausea. Her post-operative recovery was uncomplicated and she has now returned to her baseline level of function. Performance status is 0. Weight has remained stable at 68kg. Examination shows well-healed surgical scars with no concerning features.

Post-treatment CT scan on 25 April 2024 shows no evidence of disease recurrence. Blood tests including liver function and amylase are within normal range.

The plan is for surveillance with 3-monthly clinic review and alternating CT chest/abdomen/pelvis scans. Next clinic appointment will be in July 2024 with CT scan beforehand. I have provided written information about surveillance protocol and symptoms that should prompt earlier review.
